parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
How large, how great. A quantitative form of the base of pou; how much, i.e. In size or dignity.
From grapho; a writing, i.e. A letter, note, epistle, book, etc. plural learning.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; to 'grave', especially to write; figuratively, to describe.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Feminine 1st Person Singular
str2: My, mine. From the oblique cases of ego; my.
